item.title: Welch's T-test
item.description:
Image by Wxor Tmg

In hypothesis testing, there are a host of methods that could be used to perform your test. Today we’ll look at Welch’s T-test. This test excels in situations where two sample means vary significantly, specifically, if the samples have unequal variances or unequal sample sizes.

In general, this test should be used when:

  • Comparing two independent groups.
  • Unequal variances.
  • Unequal sample sizes.

The Welch’sÂ t-test is designed for unequal population variances, a relaxation of the Student’s t-test that assumes the two groups have equal variance. But similar to the Student’s t-test, Welch’s test shares the assumption that the data must follow a normal distribution.
